events.title: Security Council LIVE: Attacks against Ukrainian civilians unacceptable, unjustifiable and must stop, says UN
events.description: The UN Security Council is meeting in emergency session in New York over Russia‚Äôs ongoing deadly missile and drone strikes targeting Ukrainian civilians and energy infrastructure, as frigid winter conditions grip the war-torn country. Millions have been deprived of electricity, heating and water. The UN Secretary-General has called the stepped up attacks an unacceptable violation of international humanitarian law. Follow live below and find all our in-depth meetings coverage here. UN News app users can go here.

events.title: Sudan: After 1,000 days of war, millions of civilians still bearing brunt
events.description: Aid agencies marked 1,000 days of war in Sudan on Friday with a grim reminder that the conflict has created the world‚Äôs biggest hunger crisis and largest displacement emergency. Every day, civilians have been ‚Äúpaying the price for a war they did not choose‚Äù, said UN aid coordination office, OCHA.

events.title: Trump‚Äôs other Latin American feud: why Colombia‚Äôs Petro is not Maduro
events.description: Leftwing leader rallies his supporters as US president accuses him of drug trafficking and threatens military action A leftwing South American firebrand calls for his followers to rally in public squares nationwide to defend his country‚Äôs sovereignty and decry verbal attacks from Donald Trump. The US president accuses the leader of personally flooding American streets with illegal drugs and imposes sanctions against him and his wife. Threats of military action are followed by a phone conversation between the two leaders. One might imagine that this is a description of the buildup of tensions that led to the 3 January special forces raid on Caracas to capture the Venezuelan leader, Nicol√°s Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, to face several criminal charges in New York. Continue reading...

events.title: Russian attack on Ukrainian city of Kharkiv kills two, wounds several others
events.description: A Russian overnight attack on Ukraine‚Äôs northeastern city of Kharkiv killed two people and wounded several others, regional and city officials said on Tuesday, as Moscow continues near-daily strikes across the country.

events.title: Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and ‚Äúdriving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property‚Äù. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran: UN human rights chief ‚Äòdeeply disturbed‚Äô by protest-related violence
events.description: The UN human rights chief has called for an independent and transparent investigation into reports of deaths and widespread arrests during ongoing nationwide protests in Iran, amid mounting concerns over the use of force by security forces.

events.title: World News in Brief: Ending famine, refugee solidarity in Kenya, Ukraine civilian casualties update
events.description: The head of the UN‚Äôs emergency food agency has urged world leaders on Monday to end ‚Äúman-made famines‚Äù and conflicts that ‚Äúdrive hunger and desperation‚Äù.

events.title: Armed Iranian protesters battle police in Tehran streets as Trump warns of forceful US response
events.description: Protests in Iran turn more violent with 65 reportedly killed by Friday and over 2,300 arrested as authorities imposed an internet blackout amid nationwide anti-regime unrest.

events.title: After Venezuela, is the world order shifting from diplomacy towards aggression?
events.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks with Peter Krause of Boston College about the Trump Administration's willingness to act unilaterally against other countries and what this means for international relations.

events.title: Minnesota sues Trump administration over immigration crackdown and ICE shooting
events.description: Minnesota and its two largest cities have filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration, seeking to halt or curtail a sweeping immigration enforcement surge that followed the fatal shooting of a Minneapolis woman by a federal officer and sparked protests nationwide.

events.title: Two weeks on, questions linger over targeting and impact of US airstrikes in Nigeria
events.description: Very little information has been shared about strikes in Sokoto state Two weeks after the US carried out Christmas Day airstrikes in north-west Nigeria on what it described as Islamic State fighters, questions remain over the specific group that was targeted and the operation‚Äôs impact. In the aftermath of the strikes, Donald Trump said in a post on his Truth Social platform that ‚ÄúISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria , who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians‚Äù were hit with ‚Äúnumerous perfect strikes‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran flips ‚Äòkill switch‚Äô to hide alleged crimes as death toll rises amid protests
events.description: Iran protests spread to 180 cities as authorities allegedly use lethal force against demonstrators, with human rights activists in Iran reporting 65 killed and 2,300 arrested.

events.title: US plan to exploit Venezuela‚Äôs oil could eat up 13% of carbon budget to keep 1.5C limit
events.description: Exclusive: ClimatePartner analysis shows how move would risk plunging Earth further into climate catastrophe US plans to exploit Venezuela‚Äôs oil reserves could by 2050 consume more than a tenth of the world‚Äôs remaining carbon budget to limit global heating to 1.5C, according to an exclusive analysis. The calculation highlights how any moves to further exploit the South American nation‚Äôs oil reserves ‚Äì the largest in the world, at least on paper ‚Äì would put increasing pressure on climate goals, and risk plunging the Earth further into climate catastrophe. Continue reading...

events.title: As industry hiring slows and AI automation grows, EU workers are increasingly wary of switching jobs
events.description: The pandemic gave workers increased options as home offices became the norm in some fields. Now, with the EU experiencing industrial slowdown and AI automation, workers are growing increasingly wary of switching jobs.

events.title: Iran's Khamenei issues direct warning to United States in Russian-language posts
events.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei issues warning to U.S. in Russian on social media, signaling Tehran's growing alignment with Moscow amid nationwide protests.

events.title: Trump says Iran wants to negotiate as the death toll in protests rises to at least 544
events.description: President Donald Trump says Iran wants to negotiate with the U.S. after his threat to strike the country over its crackdown on protesters

events.title: Iran warns U.S. and Israel against military actions after deadly protests crackdown
events.description: Iran warned the U.S. and Israel against military action as activists said at least 203 people have been killed in the nationwide protests, a toll they say is likely far higher.

events.title: Carney heads to Beijing as Trump‚Äôs America First agenda forces Canada into trade rethink
events.description: Canada‚Äôs PM seeks to smooth over past ructions in relationship with China as trade war takes its toll During the final stretch of Canada‚Äôs spring election campaign, Mark Carney told a debate audience that China was the country‚Äôs ‚Äúbiggest geopolitical risk‚Äù. He pointed to its attempts to meddle in elections and its recent efforts to disrupt Canada‚Äôs Arctic claims. When Carney‚Äôs government plane touches down in Beijing this week, it will be the first time a Canadian prime minister has been welcomed in nearly a decade. The trip, undertaken amid the rupturing of global economic and political alliances , reflects a desire by Ottawa to mend a broken relationship with a global superpower that uses its vast and lucrative market to both woo and punish countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump threatens 'strong' military action as Iran protest deaths rise
events.description: Hundreds of protesters have been killed in Iran, rights groups say, as President Trump threatened "strong" military action.

events.title: Gaza: Storms worsen already dire humanitarian situation, UN warns
events.description: The humanitarian crisis across the Gaza Strip remains extremely serious, with harsh winter weather threatening to reverse recent gains in aid delivery, the United Nations said on Monday.

events.title: UN chief ‚Äòshocked‚Äô by reports of excessive force against protesters in Iran
events.description: The UN Secretary-General is shocked by reports of violence and excessive use of force by Iranian authorities against protesters across the country, urging restraint and the immediate restoration of communications as unrest enters its third week.

events.title: Sudan war leaves millions hungry and displaced as health system nears collapse
events.description: Sudan‚Äôs protracted conflict has spiralled into one of the world‚Äôs most severe humanitarian crises, with hunger, displacement and the collapse of basic services exacting a daily toll on civilians.

events.title: UN World Court begins landmark hearings on Rohingya genocide case against Myanmar
events.description: Public hearings opened on Monday at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) in a landmark case brought by the Gambia against Myanmar, alleging violations of the Genocide Convention over the military‚Äôs treatment of the Rohingya minority.

events.title: World News in Brief: Repression in Uganda, fighting in Syria‚Äôs Aleppo continues, Gaza and West Bank updates
events.description: The UN has raised serious concerns ahead of Uganda‚Äôs elections scheduled for 15 January, warning they will take place in an environment marked by widespread repression, intimidation and shrinking civic space.

events.title: South Sudan: Increase in abductions and sexual violence ‚Äòunacceptable‚Äô
events.description: Despite reductions in the overall number of conflict-related incidents in South Sudan, a rise in abductions and sexual violence is concerning, the UN peacekeeping mission in the country, UNMISS, said on Friday.

events.title: Tyler Robinson prosecutors say Charlie Kirk shooting texts show confusion, not bias, to rebut conflict claim
events.description: Accused Charlie Kirk assassin Tyler Robinson seeks to disqualify prosecutor whose child witnessed the fatal shooting at Utah Valley University campus.

events.title: DOJ charges illegal immigrant with Tren de Aragua ties after Border Patrol shooting in Portland
events.description: An alleged Tren de Aragua gang member faces federal charges for ramming Border Patrol vehicle in Portland shooting incident that sparked nationwide protests.

events.title: Attempt to overturn the Gambia‚Äôs ban on FGM heard by supreme court
events.description: Case brought by Muslim leaders and MP follows failed 2024 bid and seen as part of global anti-women‚Äôs rights backlash A group of religious leaders and an MP in the Gambia have launched efforts to overturn a ban on female genital mutilation at the country‚Äôs supreme court. The court case, due to resume this month, comes after two babies bled to death after undergoing FGM in the Gambia last year. Almameh Gibba, an MP and one of the plaintiffs, tabled a bill to decriminalise FGM that was rejected by the country‚Äôs parliament in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran protests enter third week under internet blackout
events.description: As Iran's protests enter a third week, the country's president blames foreign powers for the unrest, and warns it will retaliate if the US intervenes militarily.

events.title: Myanmar vote a ‚Äòfacade‚Äô to entrench military rule, independent rights expert says
events.description: An independent human rights expert has urged the international community to reject the electoral process organised by Myanmar‚Äôs military government, after the first round of voting revealed widespread coercion, exclusion and violence.

events.title: Live: Trump threatens Iran‚Äôs trade partners with 25% tariff
events.description: After two weeks of government crackdowns on protestors in Iran, US President Donald Trump threatened air strikes and a 25 percent tariff on countries that do business with Iran, as senior aides in the Trump administration urged him to pursue diplomacy with Tehran. At least 648 people have been killed so far, though the actual toll could be much higher. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

events.title: Ukraine: Deadly Russian strikes push civilians deeper into winter crisis
events.description: Ukraine has entered the new year under intensifying and deadly Russian attacks which have crippled energy systems and left millions without heating, electricity or water amid freezing temperatures, senior UN officials told the Security Council on Monday.

events.title: Australia news live: Queensland stock losses from floods and cyclone top 50,000 amid fears ‚Äòthat is only the beginning‚Äô, premier says
events.description: Follow updates live Adelaide writers‚Äô week 2026 cancelled as board apologises to Randa Abdel-Fattah for ‚Äòhow decision was represented‚Äô Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast New role a ‚Äòcontinuation of Rudd‚Äôs public service‚Äô, PM says Albanese said the decision to step down was ‚Äúentirely‚Äù Rudd ‚Äôs, but said the ambassador‚Äôs next role will only continue his work to advance the public interest. Kevin Rudd has a work ethic unlike anyone I‚Äôve ever met. ‚Ä¶ He sees this as a continuation of his public service, not just to Australia but to the global community. I have seen first-hand how hard he works, not just in the last few years but throughout his public life. He‚Äôs always brought an extraordinary level of energy and discipline to public service. He applied his relentless effort, his experience, intellect and determination to advance Australia‚Äôs interests in Washington, and Kevin Rudd has served the nation well. Continue reading...

events.title: Wildfires in south Argentina rip through nearly 12,000 hectares of forest, threatening communities
events.description: Wildfires in the Argentine Patagonia have burned nearly 12,000 hectares of land, threatening a power plant, a school and rural properties

events.title: Secret Service aware of UMass Lowell-funded radio DJ‚Äôs directive to ‚Äòkill JD Vance‚Äô
events.description: Radio host resigns after allegedly posting death threat against VP JD Vance on Bluesky. FBI, Secret Service investigate UMass volunteer's rhetoric.

events.title: Iran‚Äôs ‚Äòdistinctive‚Äô drone deployment sees death toll soar amid violent protests
events.description: Iran allegedly deploys drones amid nationwide protests as Human Rights Activists News Agency reports at least 544 confirmed deaths and over 10,000 arrests.

events.title: Netanyahu and Rubio discuss US military intervention in Iran amid ongoing nationwide protests: report

events.title: Trump says any country doing business with Iran will face 25 percent tariff

events.title: China pressing European countries to bar Taiwan politicians or face crossing a ‚Äòred line‚Äô
events.description: Exclusive: Chinese officials are using a ‚Äòhighly specific‚Äô interpretation of EU rules to suggest Taiwanese figures should not be granted visas, officials say Chinese officials have been pushing ‚Äúlegal advice‚Äù on European countries, saying their own border laws require them to ban entry to Taiwanese politicians, according to more than half a dozen diplomats and officials familiar with the matter. The officials made demarches to European embassies in Beijing, or through local embassies directly to European governments in their capital cities, warning the European countries not to ‚Äútrample on China‚Äôs red lines‚Äù, according to the European diplomats and ministries who spoke to the Guardian. Continue reading...

events.title: Coal power generation falls in China and India for first time since 1970s
events.description: ‚ÄòHistoric‚Äô moment in biggest coal-consuming countries could bring decline in global emissions, analysis says Coal power generation fell in China and India for the first time since the 1970s last year, in a ‚Äúhistoric‚Äù moment that could bring a decline in global emissions, according to analysis. The simultaneous fall in coal-powered electricity in the world‚Äôs biggest coal-consuming countries had not happened since 1973, according to analysts at the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air, and was driven by a record roll-out of clean energy projects. Continue reading...

events.title: Justice Department of the United States now 'a political arm of the Trump administration'
events.description: Axios is reporting that US ‚ÄçTreasury ‚ÄãSecretary ‚Å†Scott Bessent warned President Donald Trump ‚Äãon ‚ÄçSunday ‚Äãthat the ‚Äãfederal probe into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has "made a ‚Äçmess" of things ‚Äãand could harm financial ‚Äåmarkets. For insight and analysis, Fran√ßois Picard welcomes Frederick T. Davis, Lecturer in Law at Columbia University and former US federal prosecutor. Mr. Davis warns the Justice Department is being used as a political weapon, the Federal Reserve is under siege, and the federal courts have been potentially neutered by unchecked executive power.

events.title: Los Angeles wildfire recovery enters second year as frustration and uncertainty linger
events.description: One year after massive wildfires devastated Los Angeles County, many families remain displaced, frustrated by slow rebuilding, permit delays and ongoing housing challenges.

events.title: Family dog rescued after chewing battery-powered heated glove, sparking house fire
events.description: A dog was rescued from a house fire after accidentally starting the blaze by chewing a battery-powered glove, Ottawa authorities said. No injuries were reported.

events.title: 'They just kept killing': Eyewitnesses describe deadly crackdown in Iran
events.description: The BBC has received eyewitness accounts of security forces attacking anti-government protesters across the country.

events.title: Fact-finding mission urges Iran to end protest violence and restore internet
events.description: The UN-mandated independent human rights fact-finding mission on Iran has urged authorities to immediately restore internet access and halt the violent crackdown of the ongoing, nationwide protest.

events.title: As Trump urges deal, Cuban president warns that the country will defend itself 'to the last drop of blood'
events.description: As Trump pressured Cuba to strike a deal, Cuban President Miguel D√≠az-Canel Berm√∫dez asserted that the country will defend itself "to the last drop of blood."

events.title: Nigerian stars dominate All Africa Music Awards
events.description: Global superstar Burna Boy claimed the prestigious Album of the Year award for his latest work No Sign of Weakness.

events.title: Asio chief given powers to recommend organisations be proscribed as hate groups under Labor‚Äôs new laws
events.description: Neo-Nazi group the National Socialist Network claims it will disband before hate speech legislation is introduced to parliament on Monday Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australia‚Äôs spy boss will be given powers to recommend an organisation be proscribed as a hate group under the Labor government‚Äôs new religious vilification protections . The draft bill, which the government released on Tuesday, includes new hate speech and anti-vilification laws, powers to formally designate groups as proscribed organisations, and provisions for the largest gun buy-back scheme since the 1996 Port Arthur massacre. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran protests: Trump open to airstrikes, wants diplomacy
events.description: The White House says the president is considering military action against Iran to halt its clampdown on protests ‚Äî but a channel for diplomacy remains open. A rights group say nearly 650 people have been killed.

events.title: At the heart of change: Spotlight Initiative highlights breakthroughs in tackling gender-based violence
events.description: When it comes to protecting women and girls from gender-based violence, change happens when they are ‚Äúat the heart of every decision,‚Äù according to Erin Kenny, Global Coordinator of the Spotlight Initiative a United Nations‚ÄìEuropean Union partnership aimed at tackling all forms of abuse against women and girls.

events.title: US warns Americans to leave Venezuela immediately as armed militias set up roadblocks
events.description: The U.S. government issued an urgent security alert for Americans in Venezuela to leave immediately due to safety concerns and an inability to provide continued assistance.

events.title: Iranian hospitals overwhelmed with injuries as protests rage across Islamic Republic
events.description: Iranian hospitals are reportedly overwhelmed as anti-government protests rage, with doctors treating gunshot wounds to heads and eyes amid nationwide unrest.

events.title: US slams Russia‚Äôs ‚Äòdangerous escalation‚Äô in Ukraine amid new deadly strikes
events.description: The Trump administration denounces Russia's use of a nuclear-capable Oreshnik missile in a UN Security Council meeting.

events.title: Underground church says leaders detained as China steps up crackdown
events.description: Early Rain pastor said to be among those held in sweep that followed arrests of members of other unregistered churches Leaders of a prominent underground church have been detained in south-west China, according to a church statement, the latest blow in what appears to be a sweeping crackdown on unregistered Christian groups in the country. On Tuesday, Li Yingqiang, the leader of the Early Rain Covenant Church, was taken by police from his home in Deyang, a small city in Sichuan province, according to the statement. Li‚Äôs wife, Zhang Xinyue, has also been detained, along with two other church members: Dai Zhichao, a pastor; and Ye Fenghua, a lay member. At least a further four members were taken and later released, while some others remain out of contact. Continue reading...

events.title: Germany news: Ice warnings force closure of schools
events.description: Schools in many parts of Germany have closed their doors following warnings of extremely icy conditions. Meanwhile, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has started his first state visit to India.

events.title: Writer Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie accuses Lagos hospital of negligence after son‚Äôs death
events.description: In tonight's edition, iconic Nigerian author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie accuses the Lagos Euracare hospital of negligence over the death of her infant son. Also, Uganda opposition leader Bobi Wine says that he will call for protests if there are any signs of corruption in Thursday's presidential vote. And kids in Kaduna state struggle with their return to school as students are excited to see their friends, but worries about safety remain.

events.title: Ukraine: Massive overnight attack leaves millions in the dark
events.description: UN agencies are supporting efforts on Friday to keep energy services up and running in Ukraine, and families warm amid freezing winter temperatures, following a large-scale overnight attack.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Malaysia blocks Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok AI over fake, sexualised images
events.description: Country follows Indonesia in restricting access after global outcry over X‚Äôs AI tool Malaysia has become the second country to temporarily block access to Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok after a global outcry over the AI tool and its ability to produce fake, sexualised images. Malaysia said it would restrict access to Grok until effective safeguards were implemented, a day after similar action was taken by Indonesia. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump threatens Iran as country cracks down on protesters
events.description: President Trump has threatened Iran amid a deadly crackdown on protesters. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to Holly Dagres of the Washington Institute for Near East Policy about the protests.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier

events.title: What the US withdrawal from UN bodies could mean for climate, trade and development

events.title: Iran set to hang protester in what would mark first execution tied to anti-regime demonstrations
events.description: Iran is reportedly set to execute its first protester linked to mass arrests over the widespread anti-regime demonstrations. More than 500 people were also killed in the crackdown.

events.title: Trump briefed on military and covert options for Iran, sources say
events.description: The US president also imposes a 25% tariff on countries that "do business" with Tehran, while Iran's foreign minister says his country is "ready for war".

events.title: Five severed heads found hanging on Ecuador beach amid escalating gang clashes
events.description: Ecuador gang violence escalates as five severed heads discovered on tourist beach in Puerto Lopez, highlighting country's record homicide rate amid military crackdown.

events.title: How will investigators determine if Minneapolis ICE shooting was justified?

events.title: Minister Araghchi warns Iran ready for war as Trump weighs military options

events.title: US investigation into Fed Chair Powell sparks chrus of criticism
events.description: Criticism has been pouring in from Republican and Democratic lawmakers, former Fed chairs and top officials after the US Justice Department launched a criminal investigation against Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell. After he described the move as retaliation against the Fed for not lowering interest rates as quickly as the President wanted, concern over the central bank's independence pushed prices of safe-haven assets like gold higher.

events.description: No description available.

events.title: 'Miracle baby' born in a tree above Mozambique floodwaters dies aged 25

events.title: Adelaide writers‚Äô week 2026 cancelled as board apologises to Randa Abdel-Fattah for ‚Äòhow decision was represented‚Äô
events.description: Almost all remaining festival board members have resigned after backlash to decision to disinvite the Palestinian Australian author Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Adelaide writers‚Äô week 2026 has been cancelled after days of turmoil as more than 180 authors and speakers dropped out in protest of the decision to disinvite the Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah. In a statement on Tuesday afternoon, the Adelaide festival board announced the event, which was scheduled to begin on 28 February, would no longer go ahead. The three remaining members of the festival board have resigned immediately, following the resignations of four others ‚Äì with the exception of the Adelaide city council representative, whose term expires in February. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela begins releasing political prisoners, but hundreds remain behind bars

events.title: Blackout over Iran: Can the regime keep a lid on the nationwide uprising?

But French photographer Fran√ßois Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world‚Äôs oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: US frackers were already facing a global oil supply glut. Trump‚Äôs Venezuelan dream could make it worse
events.description: Picture is as murky as a barrel of oil, with US companies in 2026 expecting their first production drop in four years US shale-oil producers were already contending with oil prices at four-year lows. News that they may soon face a significant competitor in their back yard probably wasn‚Äôt how frackers wanted to greet 2026. The US capture of Venezuela‚Äôs President Nicola√° Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, hit the share prices of independent shale-oil producers, such as Diamondback Energy and Devon Energy, last week. Continue reading...

events.title: Mattel launches first Barbie with autism to promote inclusivity
events.description: Mattel creates a doll that it hopes represents some of the ways autistic people interact with the world.

events.title: French farmers drive tractors into Paris to protest EU-Mercosur trade deal
events.description: French farmers drove tractors into Paris for the second time in a week on Tuesday to protest an EU-Mercosur trade deal they say would undercut local agriculture with cheaper imports from South America. Backed by FNSEA, one of France's largest farm unions, the action adds pressure on President Emmanuel Macron‚Äôs government after most EU member states approved the pact despite Paris‚Äôs opposition.

events.title: Iran protests: Fact-checking claims of AI manipulation, low turnout
events.description: For around two weeks - and despite an internet blackout - thousands of Iranians have been mobilising in large protests that threaten the future of the ruling regime. But some internet users are casting doubt over the protest images, claiming they‚Äôre in fact much smaller than they appear, or using camera trickery or AI manipulation. Vedika Bahl goes through the claims in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Iran's rulers are more exposed than ever - protesters want them out of their lives
events.description: The big question as we watch the unrest continue in Iran: will it be enough to bring down the government?

events.title: Trump to meet Venezuelan opposition leader Machado at the White House
events.description: Machado, the winner of 2025 Nobel Peace Prize, had offered to share the honour with Trump, an award the president has long coveted.

events.title: Rubbish landslide death toll in Philippines rises to 11
events.description: The landslide occurred at the Binaliw landfill while more than 100 workers were on site.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,419
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,419 of Russia‚Äôs war on Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie accuses Lagos hospital of negligence after son‚Äôs death
events.description: Lawyers for Adichie and her husband serve Euracare hospital with legal notice after death of 21-month-old The Nigerian author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie has accused a Lagos hospital of negligence after the death of one of her 21-month-old twin boys. Nkanu Nnamdi died on 6 January after a brief illness. He was one of twin boys born to Adichie and Ivara Esege, a doctor, in 2024 by surrogacy, eight years after the birth of their first child, a girl. Continue reading...

events.title: Former Corsican separatist leader Orsoni assassinated at mother's funeral
events.description: Alain Orsoni, who led the separatist Corsican Movement for Self-Determination before becoming the president of Corsican football club ‚ÄçAC Ajaccio, was killed by a long-range shot at his mother's funeral on the French island.

events.title: 'He was shot in the heart': The teen victims of Iran's ruthless crackdown
events.description: In a large warehouse on the outskirts of Tehran, the floor is covered in dozens - or possibly hundreds - of black plastic body bags.

events.title: Roadside bomb targeting police vehicle kills 6 officers in northwest Pakistan
events.description: Police say a roadside bomb targeting a police vehicle has killed six officers in northwestern Pakistan near the Afghan border

events.title: Mom killed shielding kids after husband erupts in rage over NFL game: police
events.description: Florida mom Crystal Roure shot protecting children when husband Jason Kenney flew into rage over NFL game, police say. Roure died after telling son to call 911.

events.title: Surgeon ex-husband accused in Ohio dentist double murder reveals plea in court
events.description: Ohio dentist's wife and husband allegedly killed by her ex-husband, who waived extradition from Illinois. Michael McKee faces double murder charges.

events.title: Why political assassination cases aren't automatically death penalty eligible
events.description: Prosecutors struggle with charging alleged assassins Luigi Mangione and Tyler Robinson as U.S. law lacks clear penalties for political murders and assassinations.

events.title: Nobel Institute shuts down talk of Venezuelan leader sharing Peace Prize with Trump
events.description: Nobel Institute rejects suggestion from Venezuelan leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado to transfer her Peace Prize to Trump, stating awards "cannot be transferred."

events.title: Trump discusses whether he'd order a mission to capture Putin
events.description: President Donald Trump dismisses the idea of capturing Vladimir Putin, saying he's "disappointed" the Russia-Ukraine war remains without a resolution.

events.title: Socialist dictator Maduro gone, but Venezuelans remain wary after years of oppression
events.description: Venezuelan citizens express cautious relief after Nicolas Maduro was ousted and taken to New York to face trial, ending years of controversial socialist rule.

events.title: Custody extended for owner of Swiss ski bar after deadly fire
events.description: Jacques Moretti is being held as a potential flight risk, Swiss media reports say.

events.title: Court says Trump illegally blocked clean energy grants to Democratic states
events.description: A US district judge ruled that Trump's decision singled out states that voted for Democrats in the 2024 elections.

events.title: UK to investigate Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok over ‚Äòdeeply concerning‚Äô deepfakes
events.description: Pressure on after Starmer said Musk's X needs to 'get a grip' on Grok; Downing Street has threatened to leave platform.

events.title: UK targets Elon Musk‚Äôs X with fines and possible ban over Grok deepfake abuse
events.description: The U.K.'s communications regulator, Ofcom, launched a formal investigation into Elon Musk's X platform following reports of AI chatbot Grok creating illegal deepfake images.

events.title: Protester scales Iranian Embassy in London, tears down regime flag, hoists pre-revolution symbol
events.description: Drama played out in London when a protester reportedly scaled Iran's embassy building, tears down a regime flag and replaces it with a pre-1979 flag.

events.title: Syrian army sends troops to rural Aleppo to stop any SDF attempt to regroup
events.description: The SDF denies accusations that it deployed military forces to the Deir Hafer front in the eastern Aleppo countryside.

events.title: Thousands of nurses go on strike in New York City
events.description: Nurses were joined by elected leaders, including the city‚Äôs new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, as contract negotiations failed.

events.title: Mamdani backs striking NYC nurses, denounces hospital bosses‚Äô pay
events.description: Nearly 15,000 nurses walked off their jobs at major New York City hospitals in a health care strike.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Indonesia blocks Musk‚Äôs Grok chatbot due to risk of pornographic content
events.description: Move comes after governments and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned the AI tool and some have opened inquiries into sexualised content Indonesia temporarily blocked Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok chatbot on Saturday due to the risk of AI-generated pornographic content, becoming the first country to deny access to the AI tool. The move comes after governments, researchers and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned and some have opened inquiries into sexualised content on the app. Continue reading...

events.title: Historic upset in English soccer's FA Cup as Macclesfield beat holders Crystal Palace
events.description: The result marks the first time in 117 years that a side from outside the major national leagues has eliminated the reigning FA Cup holders.

events.title: US: Minnesota sues federal gov't over immigration crackdown
events.description: The legal action comes after a 37-year-old woman was shot dead by a federal agent in Minneapolis last week. Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison says the federal government's actions have "made us less safe."

events.title: Powell probe: 'I don't think this is helping ordinary Americans at all', economist says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Atakan Bakiskan, Economist at Berenberg Private Bank, says that the US Federal Reserve would lose its political independence should Chairman Jerome Powell resign and should the Supreme Court allow the firing of Fed Governor Lisa Cook, leaving the central bank with a majority of Trump appointees on its board.

events.title: Greenland rejects US takeover 'under any circumstance', government says
events.description: Greenland's government on Monday said it could not accept a US takeover of the Arctic island under "any circumstance", after US President Donald Trump said that the United States would take the territory "one way or the other". FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

events.title: Japan will host summit with S. Korea to bolster ties as relations with Beijing worsen
events.description: Japan‚Äôs Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi will host a summit with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung on Tuesday to ensure stable and friendly ties as her country faces growing tension with Beijing

events.title: Built on care and connection: How one Somali-British woman is strengthening diaspora communities
events.description: When her family moved from Somalia to London in the 1980s, Safia Jama watched women in her community help her mother navigate a new life in the UK ‚Äî booking doctor‚Äôs appointments, enrolling children in school, and learning how to access everyday services in a new country.

events.title: Luigi Mangione judge summons Pennsylvania cop to court to testify on backpack search
events.description: Federal judge reverses decision, will now hold hearing on Luigi Mangione backpack evidence seized at McDonald's during arrest for alleged CEO murder.

events.title: Lyse Doucet: Iran's rulers face biggest challenge since 1979 revolution
events.description: The authorities are responding to protests with a ferocious security crackdown and near total internet shutdown.

events.title: Former Fed chairs condemn criminal investigation into Jerome Powell
events.description: Three former heads of the central bank say the probe seeks to undermine the Fed's independence and "has no place" in the US.

events.title: Trump administration says still considering military strikes on Iran
events.description: The White House says that US could carry out air strikes against Iran, but would prefer diplomatic solution.

events.title: Could the US really take over Greenland?
events.description: Donald Trump's seizure threats unnerve islanders, Denmark, European Union and NATO.

events.title: Elon Musk's X faces bans and investigations over nonconsensual bikini images
events.description: After the social media app's AI chatbot started generating sexualized images of women and children, two countries have blocked it and several more have launched investigations.

events.title: NATO talks Arctic security for Greenland amid US pressure
events.description: NATO is signaling it will take steps to bolster Arctic security as the Trump administration has claimed that threats from Russia and China are among the reasons that the US government seeks to take over Greenland.

events.title: Germany and Iran: Merz calls Tehran leadership 'weak'
events.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has dubbed Iran's suppression of protests "brutal and disproportionate." A government spokesperson in Berlin backed taking one step at a time, but many in Germany want faster action.

events.title: US lawmakers to visit Denmark as Trump renews threats over Greenland
events.description: A bipartisan group of US lawmakers will travel to Denmark this week amid escalating tensions over President Donald Trump‚Äôs renewed threats to take control of Greenland, an autonomous territory within the Danish kingdom that hosts a US airbase.

events.title: 'Absence of credible alternatives' has allowed Iranian regime to survive, analyst says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Trita Parsi, Executive Vice President of the Quincy Institute, says that 'we're seeing a dramatic radicalisation of the protest movement which is ultimately a reaction to the brutality of the regime', adding that the 'absence of credible alternatives' is one of the reasons that the Islamic Republic has been able to survive despite its unpopularity, incompetence and corruption.

events.title: The man Donald Trump keeps trying (and failing) to fire
events.description: üëâ Follow Trump100 on your podcast app üëà

events.title: Cuba's president says no current talks with the US after Trump threatens it
events.description: Cuban President Miguel D√≠az-Canel says his administration is currently not in talks with the U.S. government

events.title: First responders enter devastated Aleppo neighborhood after days of deadly fighting
events.description: Residents have started returning to a contested neighborhood in Syria's Aleppo after deadly clashes between government and Kurdish-led forces

events.title: Red-Washing: How the media sanitizes a Marxist-Leninist revolutionary as a ‚Äòpreschool teacher‚Äô
events.description: Far-left consultants recommend protest groups "lead with sympathetic characters." A Grand Rapids, Mich., socialist activist got just that with an arrested member rebranded a "preschool teacher."

events.title: NYC hospital accuses nurses‚Äô union of seeking protections for workers arriving drunk, high as strike begins
events.description: Historic nurses strike hits NYC as 15,000 workers walk off. Hospitals accuse union of unreasonable demands including protections for impaired staff.

events.title: Former Navy SEAL convicted for trying to harm police with explosives during California 'No Kings' protests
events.description: Former Navy SEAL convicted of transporting explosives with the intent to harm law enforcement officers at California "No Kings" protests.

events.title: Smithsonian replaces Trump portrait display, strips Jan 6 and impeachment references from accompanying text
events.description: Smithsonian replaces Trump portrait, removes impeachment text after president calls museums "woke" and threatens funding cuts in sweeping review.

events.title: US hostages in Iran face heightened risk as protests spread, experts say number held may exceed estimates
events.description: Iran's systematic hostage-taking policy targets American citizens as political leverage, with experts calling for automatic sanctions and consequences to combat the regime's strategy.

events.title: US revokes more than 100,000 visas since Trump‚Äôs return to office
events.description: The US State Department says visa revocations have more than doubled as Trump continues his immigration crackdown.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: In Zambia, Great Lakes defense chiefs talk DRC insecurity
events.description: Over the weekend, regional defense ministers met in Livingstone to address the worsening security situation in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. However, an end to the fighting is not in sight.

events.title: China says US shouldn't use other countries as 'pretext' to pursue its interests
events.description: China says the United States shouldn't use other countries as a pretext to pursue its interests in Greenland

events.title: Venezuela: UN independent investigators call for immediate release of all political prisoners
events.description: More than 100 political prisoners have been released in Venezuela, the Government announced on Monday, just over a week after the seizure and rendition of President Nicol√°s Maduro in Caracas by the United States.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Ros√© used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Who will replace Rudd as US ambassador? Defence boss, career diplomat and former ministers in mix
events.description: Analysts and experts say the PM would do well to consider the Aukus alliance and reactions from Maga base in making his choice Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Former Labor ministers, the defence department boss and a career diplomat are among the names being touted by government figures to replace Kevin Rudd as Australia‚Äôs ambassador in Washington. Rudd, the former prime minister and foreign minister, won praise for stabilising relations with the US president, Donald Trump, on Monday, after the surprise announcement he would depart a year early to return to the Asia Society thinktank. Continue reading...

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Trump announces 25% tariff on Iran's trading partners
events.description: US President Donald Trump announced a tariff of 25% on goods from countries doing business with Iran. The tariff announcement stands to impact China, Brazil, Turkey and Russia among others.

events.title: Xinjiang whistleblower faces deportation to China ‚Äî lawyer
events.description: After documenting Xinjiang's Uyghur detention network, a Chinese dissident faces deportation to China, his lawyer says. His case highlights the clash between US immigration policy and human rights concerns.

events.title: Mattel adds an autistic Barbie to doll line devoted to showcasing diversity and inclusion
events.description: Mattel Inc. is introducing an autistic Barbie on Monday as the newest member of its line intended to celebrate diversity, joining a collection that already includes Barbies with Down syndrome, a blind Barbie, a Barbie and a Ken with vitiligo, and other models the toymaker added to make its fashion dolls more inclusive. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports

events.title: Malaysia and Indonesia become the first countries to block Musk‚Äôs Grok over sexualized AI images
events.description: Malaysia and Indonesia have become the first countries to block Grok, the artificial intelligence chatbot developed by Elon Musk's company xAI, amid concerns that it is being misused to generate sexually explicit and nonconsensual images. Britain ‚Äãwill bring ‚Å†into effect a law criminalising the creation ‚Äãof ‚Äçnon-consensual intimate images ‚Äãthis week, technology minister ‚ÄãLiz Kendall said Monday after regulator Ofcom launched a probe into ‚ÄãX.

events.title: Mexican president tells Trump that US intervention against cartels is 'unnecessary'
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum says she had a "very good conversation" with U.S. President Donald Trump about security issues

events.title: ‚ÄòBeyond GDP‚Äô economists push for clearer metrics on wellbeing, sustainability
events.description: Top finance experts are meeting at UN Geneva this week to push for a radical shake up in the way economic growth is gauged, in response to concerns that GDP measurements provide little insight about progress on key sustainability targets that are vital to our survival.

events.title: Who would rule Iran if the Islamic Republic falls?
events.description: From Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi to imprisoned activists, Iran's potential successors remain unclear. Opposition figures debate who could unify after regime change.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.description: A troop of monkeys have spent days running wild in a US city and artificial intelligence is complicating efforts to catch them.

events.title: Frightening ordeal as Sky News team forced into cars and camera seized - with dissent in China rising dramatically
events.description: In an industrial corner of the city of Shenzhen, there was a sense the system was bracing.

events.description: A former congressional IT aide is accused of stealing 240 taxpayer-funded cellphones worth $150K, shipping them to his home and then selling most at a local pawn shop.

events.title: 'We were tricked': How one woman lures foreign men to fight on Russia's front line
events.description: Recruits tell the BBC an ex-teacher who operates on Telegram misled them, saying they could avoid combat.

events.title: Pioneering gay footballer Josh Cavallo accuses former club of homophobia
events.description: Adelaide United says it "categorically rejects" Cavallo's claims he was sidelined because of his sexuality.

events.title: Jailed Venezuelan politician's son says Trump shouldn't be 'fooled' by pledge of prisoner releases
events.description: Ram√≥n Guanipa's father was accused of treason for challenging the disputed 2024 presidential election result.

events.description: The new law, which came into effect in December, is aimed at protecting children from online harm.

events.title: Thousands of tourists stranded in Lapland as cold grounds flights
events.description: All flights out of Kittila airport in northern Finland were cancelled on Sunday with temperatures falling as low as -38C.

events.description: Granting asylum to a citizen of a fellow EU member goes against the spirit of EU standards.

events.title: Chalamet beats DiCaprio to Golden Globes glory
events.description: The Marty Supreme star is among the big winners at the Globes and gets a boost in his quest for an Oscar.

events.title: Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal, before it is too late'
events.description: Trump has been turning his attention to Cuba since US forces seized Venezuelan leader Nicol√°s Maduro.

events.description: Ai's cognitive abilities had been studied extensively since she was brought to a Japanese institute in 1977.

events.description: Adelaide Writers' Week cancelled following wave of speaker withdrawals and board resignations.

events.title: Senator Mark Kelly sues US Defense Department for ‚Äòpunitive retribution‚Äô
events.description: The Trump administration has sought to censure Kelly for a video encouraging the military to reject 'illegal orders'.

events.title: Republican lawmakers break from US president on Fed chair indictment
events.description: Former fed chairs called the indictment an 'unprecedented attempt' to undermine the independence of the US central bank.

events.title: Alonso sacked by Real Madrid; replaced by Arbeloa as head coach
events.description: Xabi Alonso splits from the club a day after their Super Cup loss to Barcelona, with Alvaro Arbeloa named in his place.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship ‚Äî and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news

events.title: Malaysia, Indonesia become first to block Musk's Grok over AI deepfakes
events.description: Malaysia and Indonesia have become the first countries to block Grok, the artificial intelligence chatbot developed by Elon Musk's xAI, after authorities said it was being misused to generate sexually explicit and non-consensual images.

events.title: Latin American left responds to Trump's pledge to take over of Venezuelan oil
events.description: Latin America's left is in disarray after the seizure of Nicolas Maduro and the U.S.'s pledge to take over Venezuela's oil industry. Many on the left are changing their rhetoric about President Trump.

events.title: Trump to meet with Venezuelan opposition leader Machado
events.description: After winning the Nobel Peace Prize Trump had wanted and then being sidelined from a post-Maduro Venezuela, Machado is now set to meet with the US president.

events.title: German Chancellor Merz visits India's tech hub Bengaluru
events.description: Merz is due in Bengaluru, often called India's Silicon Valley, after meeting PM Modi in Ahmedabad. The visit comes just weeks ahead of plans to sign a long-awaited free trade agreement between India and the EU.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.description: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ‚Äï and weaknesses.

events.title: Myanmar faces Rohingya genocide case: What to know
events.description: A landmark case accusing Myanmar of committing genocide against minority Muslim Rohingya has opened at the United Nations' top court. The outcome will have repercussions beyond the Southeast Asian nation.

events.title: Croatia reintroduces conscription after almost two decades
events.description: Croatia is bringing back compulsory military service for young men for the first time since 2008. What‚Äôs behind the shift ‚Äî and could it signal a wider return of conscription in the Balkans?

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.description: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: Malaysia, Indonesia block Grok AI bot over explicit images
events.description: The move comes after the bot was found to be generating explicit images of women and children, without consent, on Elon Musk's X.

events.title: Meta shuts over 544,000 Australian accounts after ban
events.description: The tech giant removed Facebook, Instagram and Threads accounts to comply with Australia's social media ban for under-16-year-olds.

events.title: Trump to meet with Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado
events.description: Washington said on Monday that Venezuelan opposition figure Maria Corina Machado will meet President Donald Trump this week, a move that comes as pressure mounts on the interim leadership in Caracas to accelerate the release of political prisoners.

events.title: Ikon√© stuns Paris Saint-Germain as Paris FC reach French Cup last 16
events.description: Former Paris Saint-Germain academy product Jonathan Ikon√© struck a late winner against his old club as Paris FC shocked the holders 1-0 on Monday to book their place in the last 16 of the French Cup.

events.title: Iranians being kept in the dark about crackdown, observer says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Kevan Gafa√Øti, lecturer at Sciences Po Paris, who has just left Iran, says that many Iranians are being kept in the dark about the demonstrations and the brutal crackdown by the authorities due to the Internet blackout, which is preventing the population from organising.

events.title: Trump wants a deal but insists US will acquire Greenland 'one way or the other'
events.description: Donald Trump has said he wants to make a deal with Greenland and won't let Russia or China take control of the Arctic territory.

events.title: Myanmar accused of genocide against Rohingya minority in landmark UN case
events.description: Myanmar stands accused of committing genocide against members of the Rohingya ethnic minority in a case opening at a United Nations court this week.

events.title: Families of prisoners in Venezuela wait in anguish as promised releases trickle
events.description: Yaxzodara Lozada has woken up freezing on a sidewalk outside a Venezuelan prison, hoping her husband, a police officer detained in November, will be released

events.title: Cyprus president's top aide quits after online video alleging government corruption

events.title: London‚Äôs homicide rate is at a record low as mayor says it disproves Trump's 'dystopian' claims
events.description: London's murder rate fell in 2025 to its lowest level in decades, officials said Monday

events.title: UK agrees to pay 'substantial sum' to settle lawsuit by Guantanamo detainee over torture claims
events.description: The British government has agreed to pay a substantial sum to settle a lawsuit by Abu Zubaydah, a Guantanamo Bay detainee

events.title: Pope Leo XIV meets with Venezuelan opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has met with Venezuelan opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado at the Vatican

events.title: Former Polish justice minister who faces prosecution at home says he's received asylum in Hungary
events.description: A former Polish justice minister who faces prosecution in his homeland over alleged abuse of power says he has been granted asylum in Hungary

events.title: New US ambassador to India pushes for deeper trade ties despite  oil tensions
events.description: The U.S. and India are actively working on a bilateral trade agreement to strengthen their economic and strategic partnership

events.title: UN court to begin hearings on whether Myanmar committed genocide against the Rohingya
events.description: Myanmar heard accusations that it is responsible for genocide against the Rohingya ethnic minority at the top court of the United Nations, as long-awaited hearings began on Monday

events.title: Off the ballot, Ugandan president's son waits in the wings this election
events.description: Muhoozi Kainerugaba, the Ugandan president‚Äôs military son, is not on the ballot in Thursday's presidential election

events.title: Amidst uncertainty, a helpline in Pakistan becomes a lifeline for Afghans
events.description: They ask heartbreaking questions: ‚ÄúWhat will happen to us?‚Äù ‚ÄúIs it true they will deport us?‚Äù ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to go back. How can I live in Afghanistan?‚Äù The words of Sumaiya, who staffs a helpline for refugees and asylum-seekers living in Pakistan but facing the eventuality of having to return to neighbouring Afghanistan.

events.title: Minnesota sues Trump admin over sweeping immigration raids in Twin Cities
events.description: Minnesota sues Trump administration over alleged militarized immigration raids in Twin Cities, naming DHS Secretary Kristi Noem and ICE officials.
